text: sometimes we all like to over complicate

four simple but effective techniques for
getting much more done that you can
Implement right away let's jump in tip
number one is to eat the frog in his
book daily rituals Mason Curry studies
hundreds of History's Greatest artists
scientists s painters and Poets
searching for the secrets to their
success and he noticed that one habit
appeared again and again in the daily
routines of the people he studied so
what was the Habit he found that each of
them worked out what the most important
tasks for each day was and then they
prioritized that task first that was it
you'd be surprised how productive you
can be by just doing a little of what
matters most each day you see we humans
are good at tricking ourselves we think
that being productive means fitting as
much as possible into each day and
making sure we're always busy and it's
easy to convince ourselves that we're
being productive when really we're just
putting off what needs to be done we
spend our days taking off the fourth
fifth and sixth most important items on
our to-do lists telling ourselves that
we'll eventually get around to doing the
most important stuff as soon as we've
replied to our emails tidied our desks
and taken out the trash but we often end
up spending all our time on busy work
and never quite get around to making
progress towards the goals we actually
care about this this is called the eat
the Frog method you do the biggest
scariest and most crucial task right
away without thinking about it and
allowing procrastination to set in you
eat your frog immediately so that it
doesn't sit riveting away all day
getting more and more Angry once you've
done the day's most important task
you'll also find that the rest of the
day is much less stressful and that work
comes easier everything you do is a
bonus tip number two is to focus on one
thing at a time in a world of seemingly
unlimited options it could be hard to
focus entirely on one thing we don't
like picking something because it closes
the door to everything else and most

which option to pursue but the truth is
that people who try to do everything
often end up doing nothing as confucious

neither it's better to work towards one

donkey standing in front of a bail of
hay and a bucket of water both opt are
equally good for the donkey so it can't
decide which to choose and eventually
dies of hunger and thirst Derek teaches
that the best way to avoid being a
donkey is to do something donkeys can't
plan for the future most of us probably
have decades left on planet Earth we can
do most of what we want but not at the
same time we should try focusing
entirely on one thing for a week month
or year and then move on and do the same
thing with something else we can do a
lot we just need to plan ahead tip
number three use the pomero technique
the pomero technique is a surprisingly
effective productivity method used by
creatives CEOs and entrepreneurs it's a
powerful technique for helping you focus
better remove distractions and break up
your work into more manageable chunks to
try it decide what you need to do a work
task a college assignment or anything
that requires Focus set a timer for 25
minutes and work intensely on the task
for the whole 25 minutes don't look at
your phone or check the news or do any
anything unrelated to the task when
time's up set the timer again for around
5 minutes and take a break stretch your
legs Daydream or prepare for the next
stint of work try to give your brain a
rest too and don't check emails or
mindlessly surf the Internet after four
rounds give yourself a slightly longer
break to rest and recharge as a reward
for your hard work the Padero technique
works so well because it stops you from
having to make decisions while you're
doing focused work you don't switch
tasks or stop working when you feel like
it you know you're focusing for the next
25 minutes and doing nothing else and
this kind of focus is a superpower today
with everyone trying to multitask and
getting distracted constantly you'll be
surprised at how much you can get done
in 25 minutes when you're in the zone
the entire time check out our video
linked Below on how to stop

in-depth exploration of the pomera
technique as well as the Eisenhower
Matrix tip number four is to batch tasks
do you do your laundry every time you
have some new dirty socks or run to the
grocery store each time you need to
replace something you've just eaten the
answer is probably no we realize that we
use the same amount of water washing
clothes regardless of how much we wash
and the same amount of gas driving to
the store no matter how much we buy so
we do our laundry and shopping in
batches and we should do the same with
our work tasks for example instead of
answering emails when you feel like it
or whenever they come in reply to them
in batches all at once and dedicate a
specific part of your day or week to it
or or instead of picking it up and
dropping it throughout the day you could
decide to do all your creative work that
requires brain power like writing or
video editing in the morning you can
also batch on a weekly basis for
instance if you're a student preparing
for exams you could dedicate all of
Monday to one class Tuesday to another
and so on batching is so powerful
because it reduces the costs you pay
whenever you switch between types of
work a 20121 study from Cornell
University found that it takes 9 and 1/2
minutes to get back into a productive FL
after switching to a new task think
about how much that is if you're moving
all day between different types of tasks
you're probably not spending much time
in a productive State and could benefit
from trying to batch now you have the
